metadata.title: CVE-2016-10003 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Incorrect HTTP Request header comparison in Squid HTTP Proxy 3.5.0.1through 3.5.22, and 4.0.1 through 4.0.16 results in Collapsed Forwardingfeature mistakenly identifying some private responses as being suitable fordelivery to multiple clients.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10003` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
squid-cgi - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
squid-purge - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
squid3 - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
squid3-common - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
squidclient - 3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid3 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.3.8-1ubuntu6.8').
